item.title: 2025 03 29 Execute Dir permissions in Linux
item.description:
Beware of chmod -R When Adjusting Execute Bits

When adjusting execute permissions, using chmod -R can be risky. This command does not differentiate between files and directories, which can lead to unintended consequences. The execute bit has different meanings for files and directories, and using chmod -R a-x might not achieve the desired outcome. Instead, use the find command to selectively modify permissions for regular files only: the execute bit has a different interpretation on a directory than it does on a flat file. Therefore, chmod -R a-x probably wonâ€™t do what you intend. Use find to select only the regular files: $ find mydir -type f -exec chmod a-x {} ‘;’
